Class Teacher

  • java.lang.Object
    • SchoolMember
      • Teacher
  • public class Teacher
extends SchoolMember
    This class represents a teacher of a school.
    Version:
    8th September, 2018

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String[] courses
      This represents the course codes of the courses taken by the teacher.
      private int[] credits
      This represents the credits for each course.
      private int[] feedbacks
      This represents the feedback for each course.
      private static int MAX_NUMBER_OF_COURSES
      This represents the maximum number of courses allowed(10)
      private int numCourses
      This represents the number of courses taken by teacher.
      private static int REQUIRED_PERCENTAGE_FOR_PROMOTION
      This represents the required average feedback for promotion(60)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor Description
      Teacher​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address)
      Constructor for objects of class Teacher.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addFeedback​(java.lang.String course, int feedback)
      This method aims to add the feedback for a particular course.
      boolean floatCourse​(java.lang.String course, int credit)
      This method aims to float a course.
      int getAverageFeedback()
      This method provides the average of all the feedbacks and sets the chanceOfPromotion variable.
      int promoted()
      This method tells whether a teacher can be promoted or not.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method overrides the default toString method to print name and address in the form "Teacher: name + (address)".
      For example, for Name = Walter, Address = 3828 Piermont Dr,
      the string returned should be "Teacher: Walter (3828 Piermont Dr)"

        This represents the number of courses taken by teacher.

        This represents the course codes of the courses taken by the teacher.

        This represents the credits for each course.

        This represents the feedback for each course.

        This represents the maximum number of courses allowed(10)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Teacher

        public Teacher​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String address)
        Constructor for objects of class Teacher. Variables name and address are initialised using the base class's constructor. Initialise numCourses to 0 and create arrays courses, credits and feedbacks of size MAX_NUMBER_OF_COURSES
        Parameters:
        name - specifies the name of the person
        address - specifies the address of the person

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method overrides the default toString method to print name and address in the form "Teacher: name + (address)".
        For example, for Name = Walter, Address = 3828 Piermont Dr,
        the string returned should be "Teacher: Walter (3828 Piermont Dr)"
        Overrides:
        toString in class SchoolMember
        Returns:
        Returns the above specified string

      • floatCourse

        public boolean floatCourse​(java.lang.String course,
                           int credit)
        This method aims to float a course. A teacher can successfully float a course only if the course does not exist yet.
        Note: Same course with different credits cannot be floated twice.
        Parameters:
        course - specifies the name of the course
        credit - specifies the credits for the course
        Returns:
        Returns true if course successfully floated, otherwise false

      • addFeedback

        public boolean addFeedback​(java.lang.String course,
                           int feedback)
        This method aims to add the feedback for a particular course. For example, if For ex: If "ML" couse is at position 2 in courses array, the feedback passed for "ML" course should be updated at position 2 of feedbacks array.
        Parameters:
        course - specifies the course name
        feedback - specifies the feedback for the course
        Returns:
        Return true if feedback was added successfully, else return false

      • getAverageFeedback

        public int getAverageFeedback()
        This method provides the average of all the feedbacks and sets the chanceOfPromotion variable. If no courses are present, average feedback is 0.
        Note: This is an int calculation. Do not use any other datatype.
        Returns:
        Returns average of feedbacks

      • promoted

        public int promoted()
        This method tells whether a teacher can be promoted or not. A teacher can be promoted if his chanceOfPromotion satisfies the minimum percentage required specified by REQUIRED_PERCENTAGE_FOR_PROMOTION
        Overrides:
        promoted in class SchoolMember
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if the teacher can be promoted, otherwise 0
